summary: Custom logger configured via Runtime.install() was not receiving logs emitted from Rust core during worker startup and shutdown. User needed to configure log forwarding via telemetryOptions to receive all logs.
userImpact: Users implementing custom loggers miss important logs from Rust core during worker lifecycle events, making debugging and monitoring incomplete.
rootCause: Logs emitted from Rust core require explicit log forwarding configuration via telemetryOptions that was not documented clearly.
proposedFix: Configure telemetryOptions with logging filter and forward options: Runtime.install({ logger, telemetryOptions: { logging: { filter: makeTelemetryFilterString(...), forward: {} } } })
workaround: Set up log forwarding in the runtime options using telemetryOptions.logging.forward configuration.
resolutionDetails: User resolved issue by configuring log forwarding via telemetryOptions as suggested in the comment.
keyQuote: Those logs are emitted from Rust core. You'll need to set up log forwarding in the runtime options
